Package org.jtrim2.stream

Class FluentSeqMapper<T,R>

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.stream.FluentSeqMapper<T,R>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the elements of the input stream
R - the type of the elements this mapper is producing
public final class FluentSeqMapper<T,R> extends Object
Defines a convenient fluent style builder for mappers mapping a single sequence of elements. Instances of this class can be created through the toFluent() method of SeqMapper.

Mutator like methods always return a new instance and do not change the original SeqMapper instance.

For simple factory methods for initial producer implementations, see the factory methods in SeqMapper.

Thread safety

Instances of this class are immutable, and are therefor safe to be used by multiple threads concurrently. This property does not extend to the wrapped SeqMapper.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are synchronization transparent, so they can be called in any context (e.g.: while holding a lock).
See Also:
  • SeqMapper.toFluent()
  • FluentSeqGroupMapper

  • Method Details

    • apply

      public <T1, R1> FluentSeqMapper<T1,R1> apply(Function<? super SeqMapper<T,R>,? extends SeqMapper<T1,R1>> configurer)
      Transforms the wrapped SeqMapper using the given function and returns a fluent style builder for the transformation result. This method exists to allow fluent style continuation using custom transformations.

      For an instance of FluentSeqMapper named builder, this method call is equivalent to configurer.apply(builder.unwrap()).toFluent().

      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the type of the elements mapped by the returned mapper
      R1 - the type of the elements the returned mapper maps element to
      Parameters:
      configurer - the transformation transforming the wrapped mapper. This argument cannot be null, and the transformation cannot return null.
      Returns:
      the wrapped SeqMapper transformed using the given function as fluent style builder. This method never returns null.

    • map

      public <R2> FluentSeqMapper<T,R2> map(SeqMapper<? super R,? extends R2> mapper)
      Returns a mapper further mapping the output elements of this mapper.
      Type Parameters:
      R2 - the type of the elements the returned mapper maps element to
      Parameters:
      mapper - the mapper further mapping the output elements of this mapper. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a mapper further mapping the output elements of this mapper. This method never returns null.

    • mapContextFree

      public <R2> FluentSeqMapper<T,R2> mapContextFree(ElementMapper<? super R,? extends R2> mapper)
      Returns a mapper further mapping the output elements of this mapper. Each element will be further mapped by the same given mapper.
      Type Parameters:
      R2 - the type of the elements the returned mapper maps element to
      Parameters:
      mapper - the mapper further mapping the output elements of this mapper. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a mapper further mapping the output elements of this mapper. This method never returns null.

    • toContextFreeGroupMapper

      public FluentSeqGroupMapper<T,R> toContextFreeGroupMapper()
      Returns a mapper mapping (potentially) multiple sequences using this mapper. That is, each sequence will be mapped by the same mapper.

      If this mapper is not stateless, and should not be called for multiple sequences, then consider using the toSingleShotGroupMapper method for safety.

      Returns:
      a mapper mapping (potentially) multiple sequences using this mapper. This method never returns null.
      See Also:
      • toSingleShotGroupMapper()

    • toSingleShotGroupMapper

      public FluentSeqGroupMapper<T,R> toSingleShotGroupMapper()
      Returns a mapper mapping a single sequence using this mapper. That is, when mapping a group of sequences, the returned mapper will fail, if it was attempted to map multiple sequences.

      Note that the returned mapper is still reusable, that is it can be used for multiple mapping, the restriction applies within the context of a single SeqGroupConsumer.consumeAll call.

      Returns:
      a mapper mapping a single sequence using this mapper. This method never returns null.
      See Also:
      • toContextFreeGroupMapper()

    • unwrap

      public SeqMapper<T,R> unwrap()
      Returns the underlying SeqMapper instance.
      Returns:
      the underlying SeqMapper instance. This method never returns null.
